title: 49ers' Demarcus Robinson Suspended 3 Games for DUI Charge
snippets: 49ers coach Kyle Shanahan said Wednesday on San Francisco's KNBR radio that receiver Demarcus Robinson has been suspended three games stemming from a misdemeanor DUI charge.
Robinson started all 17 games last year for the Rams

<a href="https://news.google.com/rss/articles/CBMigwFBVV95cUxOWnJHMkdabzFfaU9YQ1VtdFdLeDM1NmRvd2tkeDVseF9KemNNQXZZcHJQd1RMb2ZRdzJkbGUwOWRiVndDRmdhZk96TlYxOHRUdkVsQzROSzJ1dWlCdEdOQzU2MWFWZldvSDZudUxHb1RuRHRCdlI3YkxHMlRuQ3dwM2JDNA?oc=5" target="_blank">49ers Wide Receiver Demarcus Robinson Suspended T
San Francisco 49ers coach Kyle Shanahan said receiver Demarcus Robinson is facing a three-game suspension to start the season for violating the league’s substance abuse policy.
titles: WR Robinson suspended 3 games, per Shanahan
49ers WR Demarcus Robinson to be suspended for three games after pleading no contest in DUI case
49ers Wide Receiver Demarcus Robinson Suspended Three Games - Sports Illustrated
49ers WR Demarcus Robinson faces three-game suspension, coach says
summary: San Francisco 49ers wide receiver Demarcus Robinson has been suspended for three games due to a misdemeanor DUI charge, as announced by 49ers coach Kyle Shanahan on KNBR radio. The suspension comes as a violation of the league's substance abuse policy. Robinson, who played all 17 games last season for the Rams, will miss the start of the season.

title: Saints Trade for Broncos' Vele, Exchange Two Future Picks
snippets: The Saints added to their receiver room ahead of the regular-season opener Wednesday, acquiring Devaughn Vele in a trade with the Broncos, who received two future draft picks in return.
The Saints are down to just five picks in the 2026 draft after their Devaughn Vele trade, and they won't own all of their selections again until 2028:

The Denver Broncos are alleviating some of the crowding in their wide receiver room by sending second-year pro Devaughn Vele to the New Orleans Saints for a pair of draft picks.  The Broncos will get a fourth-round selection in next year's draft and a seventh-rounder in 2027 in exchange for Vele, wh
The Denver Broncos are alleviating some of the crowding in their wide receiver room by sending second-year pro Devaughn Vele to the New Orleans Saints for a pair of draft picks.
titles: Saints acquire WR Vele, send picks to Broncos
New Orleans Saints future draft picks update after trading for Broncos WR Devaughn Vele
Saints acquire second-year wide receiver Devaughn Vele from Broncos for a pair of draft picks
Saints acquire second-year WR Devaughn Vele from Broncos for draft picks
summary: The New Orleans Saints acquired wide receiver Devaughn Vele from the Denver Broncos in exchange for two future draft picks, a fourth-rounder in next year's draft and a seventh-rounder in 2027. This trade aims to bolster the Saints' receiver options ahead of the season opener. As a result, the Saints are left with five picks in the 2026 draft and won't have a full slate of draft selections until 2028. The move helps the Broncos reduce their surplus of wide receivers.

title: Jake Paul to Fight Gervonta Davis in Atlanta on Nov 14
snippets: Jake Paul will take on WBA lightweight champion Gervonta Davis in Atlanta, Georgia on 14 November.
The latest bizarre boxing match pairs a fighter who competes at 200 pounds with one at 135 pounds
Two of boxing's biggest names will clash on Nov. 14 when Paul faces Davis at State Farm Arena in Atlanta.
YouTuber-turned-cruiserweight boxer Jake Paul and undefeated WBA lightweight champion Gervonta “Tank” Davis have agreed to fight on Nov. 14 at Atlanta’s State Farm Arena.

Jake Paul vs. Gervonta Davis fight: Social media superstar to face 'Tank' in exhibition bout in November

Jake Paul and Gervonta Davis announce they will fight on Nov. 14
summary: Jake Paul, a YouTuber-turned-cruiserweight boxer, is set to fight undefeated WBA lightweight champion Gervonta "Tank" Davis on November 14 at the State Farm Arena in Atlanta, Georgia. This match-up features two prominent figures from different weight classes, with Paul competing at 200 pounds and Davis at 135 pounds.

title: Sony Raises PlayStation 5 Price in U.S. to $550 Amid Economic Challenges
snippets: Sony said on Wednesday that PlayStation 5 game consoles will cost more in the U.S. starting this week.
The PlayStation 5 is currently the most popular gaming console in America.
Sony is hiking the price of PlayStation 5 consoles in the U.S. this week, citing a "challenging economic environment."
Price hikes go into effect August 21; standard PS5 will now start at $550.
titles: Sony raises PlayStation 5 prices in U.S. as tariffs start to hit
Sony will pass on tariff costs to U.S. consumers by hiking PlayStation 5 prices
Sony is increasing the price of the PlayStation 5 as new tariffs take hold
Sony makes the “difficult decision” to raise PlayStation 5 prices in the US
summary: Sony announced that PlayStation 5 console prices in the U.S. will increase due to a challenging economic environment. The standard PS5 will now start at $550, up from the previous price. The price hike will be effective starting August 21. The PlayStation 5 is currently the most popular gaming console in America.

title: Lamar Jackson Exits Practice Early After Foot Incident, Not Seriously Injured

summary: Lamar Jackson, the quarterback for the Ravens, exited Wednesday's practice early due to his foot being accidentally stepped on. Despite leaving 40 minutes before the session ended, a team spokesperson confirmed that Jackson is fine and not seriously injured.

title: Trump Urges Fed Governor Cook to Resign Amid Allegations
snippets: President Trump is calling for the resignation of Federal Reserve governor Lisa Cook after a Trump ally accused her of making false statements on mortgage applications.

This move marks an escalation in Trump's efforts to influence the Federal Reserve. The outcome or current status regarding Cook's position or response to these allegations has not been provided in the information available.

title: Trump Criticizes Fed, Calls for Lisa Cook's Resignation Amid Fraud Claims
snippets: Trump has targeted the Federal Reserve and its chairman, Jerome Powell, as he pressures the central bank to slash interest rates.
Trump had called on central banker to step down after his ally accused her of falsifying mortgage documents

Lisa Cook, first Black woman to sit on Fed board, responds after allegation by ally of president of mortgage fraud

  • US politics live
titles: Fed's Cook says she will not be 'bullied' into resigning after Trump official accuses her of mortgage fraud
Fed governor Lisa Cook says she will not be ‘bullied’ into resigning
Fed governor urged by Trump to resign will not be ‘bullied’ into stepping down
summary: Former President Trump has criticized the Federal Reserve and its chairman, Jerome Powell, urging the central bank to lower interest rates. Additionally, Trump has called for the resignation of central banker Lisa Cook, the first Black woman on the Fed board, after an ally of his accused her of mortgage fraud. Cook has responded to these allegations, though details of her response were not provided in the summary content.

title: Google Unveils Pixel 10 Updates with Advanced AI and Three-Camera System
snippets: The newest series prominently feature the Gemini assistant as AI increasingly becomes the battleground where device companies compete.

Gemini’s new Magic Cue feature allows chatbot to scan digital life and pull up relevant information

Google’s latest Gemini AI upgrades attempt to anticipate what useful information you made need from your life to address a potential issue, make you to better photographer or become your pers
Google is improving the base Pixel offering by introducing a three-rear-camera system to the Pixel 10.

Google's updates to the Pixel 10 line allow it to showcase what its latest AI technology can do when enhanced by the Tensor G5 processor, an upgrade to the company's custom silicon designed for the AI experience.
Pixel Journal is a new journaling app from Google that uses on-device AI to suggest writing prompts.
The tech giant says the new personal health coach is a fitness trainer, sleep coach, and wellness advisor all in one.

Google launches Pixel 10 with AI tools that anticipate users’ needs
Google launches the Pixel 10 series,  base model now has three cameras
Google doubles down on ‘AI phones’ with its Pixel 10 series

The upgrades are powered by the new Tensor G5 processor, enhancing the AI experience. Additionally, Google introduced Pixel Journal, an app using on-device AI for writing prompts, and a new personal health coach, combining a fitness trainer, sleep coach, and wellness advisor. These innovations highlight Google's focus on integrating AI into its devices to improve user experience and compete in the device

title: Israel Approves Major Settlement Expansion in West Bank's E1 Area
snippets: The plan aims to enlarge an Israeli settlement by building thousands of new apartments in the West Bank. Critics say this would essentially split the Palestinian territory and make any two-state solution untenable.

Construction would be ‘flagrant breach of international law’ and undermine two-state solution, foreign secretary says

Israel has announced it is expanding its military operations in Gaza City, as the UK foreign secretary, David Lammy, condemned its approval of a huge new illegal settlement
The long-stalled project near Jerusalem, known as E1, further fragments West Bank lands envisioned as part of a Palestinian state, advancing a goal of Israeli hard-liners.
titles: Israel approves controversial West Bank settlement plan
Israel expands Gaza City offensive as UK decries West Bank settlement approval
Israel Approves Settlements, a Blow to Faded Hopes for a Palestinian State
summary: Israel has granted final approval for a significant settlement expansion in the E1 area of the occupied West Bank, planning to build thousands of new apartments. This development is controversial because it is located in a critical area that connects Bethlehem and Ramallah, and critics argue it could split Palestinian territory in two, undermining the feasibility of a two-state solution. This move has drawn criticism from Palestinians and human rights groups, who believe it could jeopardize the prospects for a future Palestinian state.

title: Bright Meteor Lights Up Night Sky Over Southern Japan
snippets: A fireball was caught on multiple cameras lighting up the night skies in southern Japan on Tuesday evening.

Flash of light visible for hundreds of miles was an exceptionally bright meteor, say experts

A huge fireball dashed across the skies of western Japan, shocking residents and dazzling stargazers, though experts said it was a natural phenomenon and not an alien invasion.

Videos and phot
The fireball, widely believed to be an exceptionally bright meteor, shot through the sky just after 11 p.m., turning the sky bright white for a moment.
titles: WATCH:  Fireball streaks through skies over Japan
Fireball lights up sky over western Japan
Spectacular fireball streaks across western Japan, lighting up night sky
summary: A fireball, identified as an exceptionally bright meteor by experts, illuminated the night skies in southern Japan on Tuesday evening, shortly after 11 p.m. The phenomenon, captured by multiple cameras, turned the sky bright white momentarily, causing excitement and shock among residents and stargazers. Despite the spectacle, experts confirmed it as a natural occurrence, dismissing any speculation of an alien invasion. The flash of light was visible for hundreds of miles, highlighting the meteor's significant brightness and impact.

title: Jets Hold Secret Practice with Coach Glenn, No Media or Assistants Present

Only the players and coach Aaron Glenn were present

summary: The New York Jets conducted a secretive practice on Sunday with only coach Aaron Glenn and players present. No media or assistant coaches were in attendance. The purpose and details of the practice remain undisclosed.

title: Russia Demands Inclusion in Ukraine Security Talks, Criticizes Europe
snippets: Demand from foreign minister Sergei Lavrov would give Moscow an effective veto over efforts to defend Kyiv

Foreign minister Sergei Lavrov dismisses European diplomacy as ‘clumsy effort to sway Trump’

Moscow has said it must be part of any international talks on Ukraine’s security, as Russia continues to stall on Donald Trump’s push for a meeting between Vladimir Putin and Volodymyr Zelenskyy.
titles: Russia says it must be included in any Ukraine security guarantees
Russia says it must be part of international talks on Ukraine’s security
summary: Russia insists on being included in international discussions regarding Ukraine's security. Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov criticized European diplomatic efforts as ineffective and aimed at influencing Donald Trump. This stance could potentially give Moscow a veto over actions to support Kyiv amidst ongoing delays in arranging a meeting between Presidents Vladimir Putin and Volodymyr Zelenskyy.

title: Trump Aims to Mediate End to Russia-Ukraine Conflict
snippets: As Trump pushes for a peace deal to end Russia’s invasion of Ukraine, he says he has ended a growing list of conflicts. In some of them, his role remains contested.
President Trump has cast himself as a global peacemaker. His interventions have calmed some conflicts, while in others his role is less clear.
titles: Trump says he has ‘solved’ 7 conflicts. Here’s what to know about them.
Trump Says He’s Ended 6 (or 7) Wars. Here’s Some Context.
summary: Former President Trump has positioned himself as a mediator aiming to conclude Russia's invasion of Ukraine, claiming to have resolved numerous conflicts globally. While his involvement has reportedly led to de-escalation in some cases, the extent and impact of his role in others remain disputed.

title: Texas House Passes GOP Maps, May Flip 5 Seats; White House Joins TikTok
snippets: After a long day of debate, the Texas House of Representatives passed GOP-favored congressional maps Wednesday evening that could flip five Democratic districts.

The new Texas map – which now heads to the state senate, where it is expected to pass – could give Republicans five new US House seats in 2026

The White House launched an official TikTok account on Tuesday, as Donald Trump
titles: Texas House passes new GOP-friendly congressional maps
Texas house passes Republican-drawn gerrymandered congressional map after weeks of protest – live updates
summary: The Texas House of Representatives approved new GOP-favored congressional maps, potentially flipping five Democratic districts to Republican. These maps are now moving to the state senate, where they are expected to pass, potentially giving Republicans five new US House seats by 2026. In a separate development, the White House launched its official TikTok account on Tuesday.

title: NASA Study Suggests Ceres May Have Supported Microbial Life
snippets: New NASA research has found that Ceres may have had a lasting source of chemical energy: the right types of molecules needed to fuel some microbial metabolisms. Although there is no evidence that microorganisms ever existed on Ceres, the finding supports theories that this intriguing dwarf planet, w

The dwarf planet is cold now, but new research paints a picture of Ceres hosting a deep, long-lived energy source that may have maintained habitable conditions in the past. New NASA research has found that Ceres may have had a lasting source of chemical energy: the right types of molecules needed to
titles: Ceres may have had long-standing energy to fuel habitability
NASA: Ceres May Have Had Long-Standing Energy to Fuel Habitability
summary: NASA's new research suggests that Ceres, a dwarf planet, may have had a lasting source of chemical energy capable of supporting microbial life by providing the necessary molecules for some microbial metabolisms. While there is no evidence of microorganisms ever living on Ceres, the findings indicate that it might have maintained conditions suitable for habitability in the past due to a deep, long-lived energy source.

Concurrently, there are international calls for Israel to agree to a mediated truce. The situation has escalated tensions in the Middle East, with Jordan's Foreign Minister accusing Israel of undermining peace prospects. The ongoing conflict and its developments are covered in further detail in external sources.

title: Vikings Trade Harrison Phillips to Jets in Pick Exchange Deal

A federal appeals court on Wednesday sided with the Trump administration and halted for now a
titles: US court allows Trump to end temporary protections for 60,000 migrants

This decision allows Trump administration officials to proceed with deportation plans for people from these countries. The current status is a pause on the protective order, pending further legal actions.

In 2009, NASA’s Chandra X-ray Observatory released a captivating image: a pulsar and its surrounding nebula that is shaped like a hand. Since then, astronomers have used Chandra and other telescopes to continue to observe this object. Now, new radio data from the Australia Telescope Compact Array (A
titles: Astronomers combine X-ray and radio data to map pulsar 'hand' nebula

summary: In 2009, NASA's Chandra X-ray Observatory unveiled an image of a pulsar and its nebula, resembling a hand. Continuous observations have been made using Chandra and other telescopes. Recently, the Australia Telescope Compact Array provided new radio data on this celestial object, enhancing our understanding of its structure and properties.

title: UCSF Scientists Identify Protein Linked to Brain Aging, Potential Treatment Path
snippets: Scientists at UCSF have uncovered a surprising culprit behind brain aging: a protein called FTL1. In mice, too much FTL1 caused memory loss, weaker brain connections, and sluggish cells. But when researchers blocked it, the animals regained youthful brain function and sharp memory. The discovery sug

Researchers discovered two brain regions that work as a “neural compass,” keeping people oriented in virtual city navigation. These areas tracked direction consistently, hinting at new ways to detect and monitor neurological disorders that cause disorientation.
titles: Scientists just found a protein that reverses brain aging
Scientists just found the brain’s secret GPS system
summary: Scientists at UCSF identified a protein, FTL1, as a key factor in brain aging, causing memory loss and weaker brain connections in mice. Blocking FTL1 reversed these effects, suggesting a potential target for treating age-related cognitive decline. Additionally, researchers found two brain regions acting as a "neural compass" for orientation in virtual environments. This discovery could lead to new methods for diagnosing and monitoring neurological disorders that impair navigational skills.
